variation.name: Creates a fail case when an operating item appears in the investing section of the CF statement.
variation.description:
Creates the following fail case: The concept us-gaap:ProceedsFromSaleOfOtherAssets1 appears in the investing cashflows of the companies cash flow statement. us-gaap:ProceedsFromSaleOfOtherAssets1 is an operating item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow generated from operating activities. Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item. 
 {us-gaap:ProceedsFromSaleOfOtherAssets1}

variation.name: Creates a fail case when an financing item appears in the investing section of the CF statement.
variation.description: Creates the following fail case: The concept us-gaap:IncreaseDecreaseInTimeDeposits appears in the investing cashflows of the companies cash flow statement. us-gaap:IncreaseDecreaseInTimeDeposits is a financing item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow generated from financing activities. Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item. \n {us-gaap:IncreaseDecreaseInTimeDeposits}

variation.name: Creates a fail case when an investing item appears in the financing section of the CF statement.
variation.description: Creates the following fail case: The concept us-gaap:PaymentsToAcquireEquipmentOnLease appears in the financing cashflows of the companies cash flow statement. us-gaap:PaymentsToAcquireEquipmentOnLease is an investing item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow generated from investing activities. Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item. \n {us-gaap:PaymentsToAcquireEquipmentOnLease}

variation.name: Creates a fail case when an operating item appears in the financing section of the CF statement.
variation.description: Creates the following fail case: The concept us-gaap:PaymentsForLoans appears in the financing cashflows of the companies cash flow statement. us-gaap:PaymentsForLoans is an operating item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow from operating activities. Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item. \n {us-gaap:PaymentsForLoans}\n
